result.execSummary:
The defendant Cole L. Pederson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must appear today at Probation.
Concurrent with: 15CM232

miscConds.notes: $263.50 fine/cost to be paid to Clerk of Court Office by way of payment plan of $25.00 per month commencing on July 1, 2016 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full for Attorney Fees. Bond to be applied towards fine and attorney fees.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court office which will be taken out of bond.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
Must comply with all Mental Health Regimens.

timeConds.notes:
For use by Probation Agent if necessary.
Concurrent with: 15CM232
